      • getSimpleDateFormat

        public static java.text.SimpleDateFormat getSimpleDateFormat(int formatType,
                                                             @Nullable
                                                             java.lang.String delimiter,
                                                             @Nullable
                                                             java.util.Locale locale)
        Get the SimpleDateFormat to be used
        Parameters:
        formatType - The format type to do (See PGMacTipsConstants, IE DATE_YYYY_MM_DD)
        delimiter - delimiter to separate them. (IE / or - or ,). If null, will use nothing
        locale - Locale object Locale . If null, defaults to United States (US)
        Returns:
        SimpleDateFormat

      • convertDateToString

        public static java.lang.String convertDateToString(java.util.Date date,
                                                   int formatType,
                                                   java.lang.String delimiter,
                                                   java.util.Locale locale)
        Formats a date into a String
        Parameters:
        date - The date to be converted
        formatType - The format type to do (See PGMacTipsConstants, IE DATE_YYYY_MM_DD)
        delimiter - delimiter to separate them. (IE / or - or ,). If null, will use /
        locale - Locale object Locale . If null, defaults to United States (US)
        Returns:
        Return a String of the converted date

      • getAge

        public static int getAge(java.util.Date birthday)
        Get the age of the user. Takes in their birthday and calculates it according to today's date
        Parameters:
        birthday - Date Object
        Returns:
        Returns an int of their age (IE 20, 55, 18). If the date is in the future, it will return -1 instead.

      • getCurrentDay

        public static java.lang.Integer getCurrentDay(long timestamp)
        Same as the getCurrentDay() method but uses the passed in argument as a long milliseconds timestamp to calculate vs a day object
        Returns:
        Day Day of the year based on timestamp.

      • getCurrentDay

        public static java.lang.Integer getCurrentDay(java.util.Date date)
        Returns the day of the year (IE 365 = Dec 31st)
        Parameters:
        date - This is the date to use to calculate the day of the year
        Returns:
        Day - Day of the year based on date.

      • getDateAdjustedByHours

        public static java.util.Date getDateAdjustedByHours(int hrs)
        Determines the Date "date" adjusted by the number of hours passed in. A Negative int will go back a few hours. This always uses the current date/ time as opposed to the getDateAdjustedByDays() method below which uses the passed in Date argument as the base to use.
        Parameters:
        hrs - Number of hours to adjust by
        Returns:
        Returns a date object

      • getDateAdjustedByDays

        public static java.util.Date getDateAdjustedByDays(java.util.Date date,
                                                   int days)
        Determines the Date "date" adjusted by "days". A negative value will return a date in the past.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to be adjusted
        days - The number of days to adjust by
        Returns:
        Returns a date object

                           java.util.Date dayOne)
        Return the difference between 2 dates (dayTwo - dayOne) in days
        Parameters:
        dayTwo - The first day to compare against
        dayOne - The second day to compare against
        Returns:
        an int of the difference between the 2 days

      • before

        public static boolean before(java.util.Date startDate,
                             java.util.Date endDate)
        Checks start and end dates to compare which came first
        Parameters:
        startDate - start date of event in Date object format
        endDate - end date of event in Date object format
        Returns:
        True if first date BEFORE second date OR second date is NULL

      • buildSequentialDateStrings

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildSequentialDateStrings(java.util.Calendar cal,
                                                                          int numberOfDaysToIncrement)
        Builds list of Strings like this: "Tuesday October 25" and increment to the next one of "Wednesday October 26".
        Parameters:
        cal - Calendar to use for incrementing. If left null, it will create a new calendar instance at the time of this call
        numberOfDaysToIncrement - Number of times / days to increment
        Returns:

        public static java.lang.String getWeekdayInPast(int yearsAgo,
                                                int monthsAgo,
                                                int daysAgo)
        Get the weekday in the past. IE, You want to know what day it was 4 years, 3 months and 2 days ago (--> 'Tuesday')
        Parameters:
        yearsAgo - # of years ago (Positive number)
        monthsAgo - # of months ago (Positive number)
        daysAgo - # of days ago (Positive number)
        Returns:
        String day of week. getDayOfWeek()
